item.title: Understanding VLAN Trunking Protocol (VTP) in Cisco Networks
item.description: Introduction VLAN Trunking Protocol (VTP) is a Cisco-proprietary protocol that simplifies the management of VLAN configurations across a network. It is particularly useful in large networks with numerous switches, helping to manage VLANs more efficiently and ensuring consistent configurations. Use Cases for VTP Simplifying VLAN management across multiple switches. Ensuring consistent VLAN configuration and avoiding mismatches. Reducing administrative tasks related to VLAN maintenance.
